data.title: Super good Pizza!!!
data.text: We were visiting relatives in town during restaurant week. The place was packed! There was easy parking across the street. We waited less than 10 minutes. My husband and I shared the "Magic Mushroom" pizza. It had wild mushrooms, pesto and balsamic vinaigrette drizzled over it. The flavor was AMAZING!! We had a couple pieces left over for the next night that were just as wonderful! Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Could have been in Tuscony Italy
data.text: Located just off the towns main street it has ample car parking.  To the front is an open terrace were you can dine alfresco.  It trades as a pizza restaurant but offers far more.  Owned and run by a local Italian family it offers a full range of good traditional Italian dishes and wine that have not been Americanised – covered in cheese.  One of the family served us and we could have been in Italy dining.  A great dining experience.

data.title: Ellen
data.text: Fun, relaxing, good menu, good food. The prices are decent. Great wine and beer selection. Not your normal pizza menu. Worth a try if you've never been.

data.title: Great Italian Family Restaurant
data.text: Have eaten there quite a few times and the food and service are superb.   My favorite is the lasagna.   Smothered in cheese and one of the best I've ever had.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Great BBQ Chicken pizza, breadsticks, and chop salad!!!  Ate outside and it was nice.  Very good service.

data.title: Vegan friendly!
data.text: Just arrived in Suffolk and were so hungry, Amici was the first restaurant we found. Glad we did! Our waitress was lovely. I asked for a vegan version of a meal and wasn't disappointed. A huge dish of fresh veggies and vegan pasta! Hubby enjoyed his pizza too. Great food and service. Perfect!

data.title: Good Food and Service
data.text: The only problem here is that it can get loud. The food and the service are consistently great. Big parties can create a seating problem so call ahead. They some of the best pizza in town (and you can order it for carry out).

data.title: Nice Italian Restaurant
data.text: I visited this restaurant while on a business trip. I found the staff to be very friendly. The service was extremely prompt. The food was flavorful and very filling.

data.title: One of our home town favorites.
data.text: We visit here quite often and I have never reviewed...shame on me.  We have been eating here since it opened.  Over the years, they have had a few bumps in the road, such as when the cook quit and when they changed food suppliers for some of the ingredients.  However, as an overall restaurant experience, you will be quite pleased.  My daughter loves their shrimp and grits.  The pizzas are fam favs, the New Yawka, BBQ chicken, BBQ shrimp, and the list goes on and on.  I have never been disappointed, from the lasagna to the Penna Ala Vodka, Baked Ziti, to the steaks.  The fresh baked bread and butter is a nice touch to the meal.  They have a full wine list and very large beer list.  The salads and the appetizers are very good.  They usually offer a Valentine's Day special, which includes a bottle of wine and they offer specials during restaurant week.  Our most recent visit was on Father's Day and the entire family enjoyed our casual lunch.  I will say the servers have been excellent and a few have needed more training, but overall service has been good for us.  If you are a local, you can almost be assured to run into family or friends while visiting.  The AC is sometimes very cold, so I would suggest a wrap, perhaps.  The place can get noisy with the very high ceilings.  There is an outdoor patio that has very nice seating during warmer weather, and they also have patio heaters during the winter months, if that appeals to you.  Overall, a very nice place to hang out with family and friends in a casual environment.  I would highly recommend.

data.title: Very good food, adequate quantity, and great service
data.text: If you want good food, this is the place. The staff is always helpful, you take food home, and it is really good. The specialty... Come on, Amicis. This is not a BBQ place.

data.title: Nice dinner
data.text: Casual, relaxed atmosphere. Great service. Had the caprese brushetta and for dinner, the salmon. FANTASTIC! would definitely eat there again!

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Very nice Italian restaurant, very friendly staff, large variety on the menu. My wife and I decided on a new York style pizza. As we watched the other food coming to their waiting customer, it all looked great

data.title: Good Italian food
data.text: Been here for special occasions and just to have lunch.  Everything has always been good.  A great selection to choose from.

data.title: Fabulous little Italian Joint in Downtown Suffolk
data.text: One of my favorite things to do on vacation is order a pizza from a "Mom & Pop" Italian restaurant wherever I am visiting, so my Mom, Sis and I popped in to Amicis for lunch yesterday. I am so glad we did! We had a Margherita pizza and it was delicious! In fact, not sure what I enjoyed more... the yummy stringy cheese, the tasty homemade sauce, the crispy and just-right crust, or our terrific server - whose name escapes me but he was excellent. I highly recommend the pizza and will visit Amicis again when I return to Suffolk!!

data.title: Great little Italian place!
data.text:
Delicious! We found this place for lunch after a recommendation from some locals. The offerings on the menu are exceptional, but there were awesome specials as well. Great pizzas and pasta dishes are included on the menu. 
Food, service, atmosphere were excellent. Definitely would recommend and definitely will return on our next trip to Suffolk.

data.title: VP, Sales
data.text: Absolutely amazing food. On par with some of the best Italian restaurants I have eaten at!  Classic food with a modern twist!

data.title: A+ Across the Board!
data.text: I give this restaurant an "Excellent" in every aspect.  The food was delicious and wonderfully prepared, the service was fantastic, and the atmosphere was very enjoyable and comfortable.  It is very family friendly and our entire party thoroughly enjoyed their entrees.  And they are very reasonably priced!  I give this restaurant a top notch recommendation!

data.title: Lousy
data.text: Very disappointing. Order the small white pizza it was undercooked crust soggy an overloaded with garlic from a jar. Also try to Philly cheese steak and fries, never again. Fries were limp and greasy, and the sandwich was not much better.

data.title: OMG!
data.text: This is easily the best Italian restaurant that I've ever been to.  The menu is extensive for both food and drinks.  The food is superbly prepared and presented.  The seafood spaghetti is astounding.  The food and service was so good, that we went back the next night for p;pizza.  You have not lived until you have their pizza.  Great crust, great ingredients, great taste combinations and a superior job of baking.  If you're staying in Suffolk, you must eat here.

data.title: Not your ordinary Italian restaurant
data.text:
One of the best pizza places and most tastiest. We ordered 6 18" pies, each pizza had two flavors to it. The barbecue chicken and Buffalo chicken were my favorites. I've also had their Italian blt sub - awesome!
My 13yr old wanted to make it our Friday night tradition.
I did not take pictures because that would have only made you drool.
